title: Meddler said that they are nerfing Eve due to her being strong at pro play
body: I don't understand that. I remember that some time ago Riot Repertoir claimed that they don't nerf a champion based on their performance at profissional play. And then, there is this. Can someone explain that?

replies.body: We primarily balance around high tier ranked play, with some adjustments for both pro play (which tends to be very similar, but not identical, to high tier ranked play) and lower levels of play (adjustments to champions that pubstomp mainly, like Yi in some MMR ranges). At times that weighting of what's important will also get shifted a bit as we focus more on one type of play than we usually do. Since the next patch (5.18) is the one the World Champs will be played on we're looking at pro play significant champions more than usual, hence the investigation of whether we need to make any changes to Eve.

So you're suggesting that the roster should be balanced according to divisions, and champs should only appear in their desired elo bracket?

Not sure if I read it wrong (I hope I am here) but that's just a wrong mentality to have especially when you're supposed to be balancing the game.

Even yourself also said that
 >At times that weighting of what's important will also get shifted a bit as we focus more on one type of play than we usually do. 

Then in the next sentence following that you said
> we're looking at pro play significant champions more than usual, hence the investigation of whether we need to make any changes to Eve.

Huh?

Champions have different strengths and weaknesses at different levels of play. Eve is strong at higher levels of play because players know how to play her well. Hence the nerfs. The juggernauts might be strong in all levels, but they're nightmares in low ranks.

I kinda have to agree with both of you a bit. Evelynn's problem is that the stealth mechanic as a whole is not in a healthy state. If they want to nerf Evelynn, they ought to do it by offering itemization that allows better counterplay to her stealth, not her kit.

Lee has often been up there as an option. But he's also rarely been the top tier jungler worthy of bans (at least this seasons, I haven't seen as much of previous seasons). He's often picked as the left over option right now when a pro jungler has their main champions picked and banned away from them.

Perhaps more importantly is that the changes to Lee mostly help low tier players, not pros. They have very little impact on pro play.

Also where are you getting this mere 1 or 2 appearance thing from? Are you talking about Evelynn? She's seen **tons** of pro play this season.

I think Riot agrees with you on that. But Evelynn has seen play throughout much of the season in either all or most regions, including playoffs and even MSI. I don't think it's remotely unreasonable for them to look at whether or not she needs a nerf.
